total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern of the color changes in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the color changes are based on the shape of the 8s in the grid.
Q3: Identify the shapes formed by the 8s in the input grid of the quiz.
Q4: Apply the color changes to the shapes identified in Q3 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q5: Notice that the color changes are not random but follow a specific pattern. Identify this pattern.
Q6: Apply the color change pattern identified in Q5 to the shapes identified in Q3 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q7: Notice that the color changes are not applied to all the cells in the grid but only to those that are part of the shapes identified in Q3. Identify these cells in the input grid of the quiz.
Q8: Apply the color changes to the cells identified in Q7 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q9: Notice that the color changes are not applied to the entire shape but only to certain parts of it. Identify these parts in the input grid of the quiz.
Q10: Apply the color changes to the parts of the shapes identified in Q9 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q11: Notice that the color changes are not applied uniformly but vary depending on the position of the cell in the shape. Identify this variation in the input grid of the quiz.
Q12: Apply the color changes taking into account the variation identified in Q11 to the input grid of the quiz.

Q1: Identify the pattern of the color changes in the examples.
Q2: Determine the rules for changing the color of the cells.
Q3: Identify the cells that are surrounded by the color 8 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q4: Apply the color change rules to the cells identified in Q3.
Q5: Generate the output grid by applying the color changes to the input grid.
